intro: Psychotria katikii, commonly known as the Katikii Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by local wildlife. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
